ratings.comment: Professor Wallen tried to make lectures entertaining but most of the time they felt very long and did not provide much to learning new topics. When explaining his lecture slides he bounced from one idea to the next which often made it more confusing. His exams were also filled with confusing questions mean't for only some to understand.

I had Wallen for the first part of the in-person semester, and he is a passionate guy who obviously cares about his students and chemistry. However, during class he spends a lot of time doing tophat questions. The practice questions and exams are not remotely reflective of the midterms, which are difficult(though this may be a universal 104 thing).
His exams are unnecessarily difficult. You think you know the material and then the exam is in another language.
His exams do not make sense and are often a lot more complicated than they have to be. He is a very tough grader. He is not good at explaining directions/assignments.

During online school, the chemistry department has Dr. Wallen doing the online lecture videos. He does a fantastic job of explaining the topics clearly and in detail and also tries to make the lectures enjoyable (and succeeds) While I didn't have Dr. Wallen as an official professor, I would take a class taught by him after this!

He's mediocre-okay. He would waste a lot of time in lectures just walking around during easy Top Hat questions, sometimes up to 10 minutes, which was incredibly annoying. He wasn't that good at explaining concepts either, so we would usually be answering questions that we hadn't really learned about yet. The curve at the end was really strange.

Probably I am not good at chemistry at all, but the thing is that he did not teach you chemistry in the class. All he did is reading the slides and he never commented any concept on the slide, which makes the material unclear to me and he then asked a bunch of questions in the exam he did not explain during the class as if we knew the concepts.
Tests were hard, final grading was unclear, the curve cutoff is not generous and strange. However, he seems nice and passionate about chemistry

Very nice guy, cares a lot about students who care to learn. Lectures were too TopHat heavy, I would have appreciated him teaching us rather than teaching through TopHat. Exam questions resembled practice problems well, but tests were long to bring down the average.

Dr. Wallen is an amazing professor. He is understandable, discusses major concepts, and, despite coming across as somewhat nervous during lectures, his personality makes up for it and he makes learning the content enjoyable even if you don't like chemistry. You will want to attend lecture to full understand the concepts though

Really not a good professor. Does not come across as if he knows the material. Makes no sense in lecture. Spends all lecture time over the simplest concepts and skips over the hard material saying, "You guys can brush up on this outside of class."
